newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ's Infratil yet to commit half of issue proceeds.
newsitem.headline: NZ's Infratil yet to commit half of issue proceeds.

text.p: Infrastructure and Utilities Ltd (Infratil) said on Wednesday it had committed about half the proceeds of its NZ$45 million July cash issue.

"Funds from the July cash issue have been progressively invested during the six months under review such that 50 percent of the total funds raised were committed at September 30, with the market value of Infratil's portfolio being approximately $208 million including cash and adjusted for tax on holdings in Infratil Securities Limited," the company said.
Infratil earlier reported a 19 percent rise in first half net profit to NZ$1.75 million from $1.47 million.
Dividends received were up 86.7 percent to $2.281 million. Net interest received fell to $154,000 from $722,000 reflecting the cost of borrowings prior to receipt of the cash issue proceeds.
Net tangible asset backing stood at 110.7 cents per share at September 30 and 114.0 cents on October 21.
Infratil is an investor in the infrastructure and utilities sector. -- Wellington newsroom 64 4 473-4746
